question_text: Which one is correct about anti thrombotic?

options.option_a: apixaban + rivaroxaban Ar direct thrombin inhibitor

question_text: 26 Young lady with SLE complained of seizures and confusion this time. SLE nephritis on dialysis. What is your diagnosis? MRV was venous thrombosis in transverse CVT

Which of the following is the correct mechanism of action of these medications:
- Aspirin inhibits adenosine deaminase
- Ticagrelor inhibits P2Y12
- Apixaban and rivaroxaban are direct thrombin inhibitors
- Clopidogrel inhibits factor 7, 10, 11, 12

options.option_c: Apixaban and rivaroxaban are direct thrombin inhibitors

question_text: Patient had cerebellar ICH near 4th ventricle with dilated lateral ventricles and 3rd ventricle. Which of the following is next:

options.option_a: Insert EVD and release high ICP
options.option_b: Do CT angio to look for posterior criculation aneurysm
options.option_c: Other choices I forgot which were irrelevant

question_text: male elderly with left side weakness dysarthria on dabigatran underwent thrombectomy only no tpa given later has ct of bleeding what you will give that was the cause of increase bleeding

A patient had a head trauma, after 10 days developed spontaneous perimesencephalic SAH. Done 2 digital subtraction imaging 2 weeks apart which was unremarkable, which of the following is the appropriate management:

options.option_a: Send him home with F/U in the clinic
